commentaire: We used GoHenry for our three kids personal debit accounts. We were getting charged ~$10/month for the service. At one point, I noticed an unapproved charge show up on one of the cards. I immediately went into the GoHenry app and used the "block" feature, which I thought would turn off the card to any further transactions. THIS DID NOTHING. Apparently, if it's a subscription fee certain vendors can get around GoHenry's feature and the charges kept accruing. At that point, I asked the GoHenry support to help remedy this and they basically told me I had to go fix it directly with the vendor. So - for $10/mo I was getting limited functionality to help when cards get lost or stolen and decided to cancel. I've now switched all kids accounts to "custodial" accounts at my normal bank (one of the top 5 U.S. banks) and they basically have all the same functionality, plus legitimate fraud claims departments. The additional setup with the bank was well worth the $120/year fee I was paying to GoHenry.

reply.reply_text:
I am sorry to hear about your experience when you noticed an unrecognised charge, I appreciate you contacted us to report this but felt the information provided was not satisfactory and therefore, led you to cancel your account and switch to another service.

As we are a financial service we cannot block retailers from taking payments in the same way a bank would be able to, therefore if a recurring payment or a subscription is set up on your child's account, we would first ask that you contact the retailer to cancel and resolve this, however, we do have an alternative process in place in case you are unable to reach out to the retailer and resolve the matter. I understand that this matter can be a cause for concern and we always try to assist our members with these cases as much as possible.

I would like the opportunity to look into this further and assist you with this, however, as you have not provided Trustpilot with your email address, I have been unable to locate your account.

Please send us an email with the subject heading - "FAO Supervisors - Issues" to help@gohenrycard.com, from the email address you used to set up the account and one of our team will be in touch directly.

Thank you for bringing this to our attention and we look forward to hearing from you.

Morgan - GoHenry Supervisor.

Titre: My brother has a disability and they…
commentaire: My brother has a disability and they have no respect for that. We did a three way on a call and they go and have him look up information, log into an account he doesn't have, and they don't care how difficult it is. I called three times just to ask about his financing, one rep says all we need is his VIN, another says we just need a social, then the last one asks about dates and all this financial crap. They are the worst. I don't recommend them at all and they do not care about people with disabilities or have any sympathy when it comes to their clients. I will be reporting them to the BBB.

Titre: Bank Would Not Authorize Money For Security Deposit For Moving
commentaire: I am in the process of moving, already a very stressful situation. I've been with PNC at least 10 years and when I went to get the money orders for my security deposit to drop off Monday (it's Saturday), bank did not authorize the $2,790. Money orders need to be purchased with a debit card or cash, can't mix and match. When I called the bank they said my debit card is capped at $2,000. I explained I NEED this money for my security deposit as I am moving. They would not make an exception or authorize the $790 I needed!!! WHAT?!!! This is my money!! I am so livid I could scream. I work full time and had to coordinate the time off to go drop off my security on Monday and now I am screwed because Monday is a bank holiday and they're closed. THANK YOU PNC FOR MAKING MY LIFE EVEN MORE OF LIVING HELL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Can't wait to find a new bank.
Refuse to tell me full name and rep number after 1/2 hour non sense conversation to answer my questions , repeat same answers like broken vinyl , just hang up on me , well done !!

Titre: They will do anything to keep your money when you close your account including lies , delays, blames etc.
commentaire:
wanted to withdraw a good chunk of my savings, they said the account is locked due to non activity! (this is a savings account not checking!) takes 2 days to re activate, four days later, nothing, called again, each call is a 15-20 min wait and Q&A, they said they don't know why but it did not happen so another couple days, NOTHING! I needed my money so I asked them to close the account and transfer my money to another bank. their policy! due to large amounts of money they can not transfer and they will send me a check Within 7 to 10 days!. 11 days later, NOTHING! called again, she checked and said it was processed yesterday! and i should get it within 7 to 10 days! now 21 days later and NOTHING! called, sent from this girl to that guy , customer service to fraud dep. hanged up couple of times, had to file a complaint, got call next day, she said wait you may get it or apply for a stop payment, which they will mail me a document so I have to fill in and notarized and mail it back to them then they will check it out and hopefully put a stop payment on the previous check and re send another check, It may take few weeks!
Through it all, every time I asked for a tracking number or some kind of verification that the check is in the mail and they said they don't have any tracking number and they can not provide me with any proof other than the check number!
Now It's the 4th. week and I am waiting for the paper they are going to send me, in the meantime I lost the deal that I needed the money for and lost thousands on interest. DO NOT WORK WITH pnc IF YOU VALUE YOUR MONEY.

It would help if they would listen to customers. I am helping my mom (elderly, English not first language, computer illiterate, marginal ability to use smartphone, father managed EVERYTHING before he died) to close a HELOC that she didn't even know was open (0 balance) so that we can close on the sale of her home in 2 days. One person yesterday was extremely helpful, but we could go no further as a HELOC close date had not been entered yet. We had to call again the next day (today) via 3 way conference call with my mother. We could not get past verifying her identity. They would not listen to our situation. They kept saying they could not verify her identity even though she verbally gave them her name and SSN. They asked her to confirm the amount of any withdrawal or deposit into her checking account, and she did not understand what they were asking. They did not make her do this the day before, so we didn't prepare any statements to be on hand. I tried to explain and they told me that no one was supposed to be on "the other line." I have previously witnessed my mother be unable to manage a phone tree. She was clearly struggling to find a paper statement. They let her do this for several minutes. I asked if I could provide the information since I set up and manage online access for her. They said no. I asked if there was an email that I can send a power of attorney form to. Nope. Nothing from them except "rules are rules". They would not even look into the system to verify our story that we had faxed a letter last week to close the account. All we wanted was to have them fax an "in process" letter to the closing attorney's office when it became available. Honestly it would have been much easier for me to lie and impersonate my mother to get the HELOC closed myself. Lesson learned.
